block.p: Dr. Robin Beth Hodess and Dr. Arne Delfs were married last evening by Rabbi Richard Messing at the Pierce House in Lincoln, Mass.

The bride, 33, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a program officer at the Carnegie Council on Ethics and International Affairs in New York. In June, she is to move to Berlin, where she will manage a research and writing project for Transparency International, a nonprofit organization that seeks to curb corruption in government and business. She graduated magna cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania and received master's and Ph.D. degrees in international relations from Cambridge University in England. Her parents, Marjorie Hodess and Dr. Herbert Hodess, live in Quincy, Mass., where her father is a dentist.

The bridegroom, 34, is a political correspondent for the Berliner Morgenpost, a daily newspaper in Berlin. He graduated with a master's degree in American studies from Frankfurt University and also received a Ph.D. in American studies from the Free University in Berlin. His mother, Eike Delfs-Jeske of Trent, Germany, retired as a bookkeeper for the Lutheran Church in Preetz, Germany. His father, Klaus Delfs of Moltenort, Germany, was the managing director for loan operations at Kieler Volksbank, a bank in Kiel, Germany.
